title: Polish credit change removes lustre from sub-prime lender
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Polish credit change removes lustre from sub-prime lender Unlike the Polish WIG stock indices yesterday, shares in International Personal Finance tumbled RAFAL GUZ/EPA Unlike the Polish WIG stock indices yesterday, shares in International Personal Finance tumbled RAFAL GUZ/EPA Harry Wilson City Editor Published 1 minute ago 
Shares in one of eastern Europe’s biggest sub-prime lenders lost a quarter of their value after it warned that a change in Polish credit rules would mean that the charges it imposes on customers could be severely restricted. 
International Personal Finance said yesterday that the amendment to Poland’s draft consumer finance law could have a “adverse financial impact” on its business in a country where it generates more than half its profits. 
Under the Polish proposals, interest charges on consumer loans will be subject to a flat rate of 25 per cent, dramatically eroding IPF’s previous profit margins. According to Subscribe now
